title: The recent winner of the Powerball in Ashville took the lump sum payout. Why was there such a difference in the actual winnings to the actual payout?
text:
Lottery winnings are taxable income, so taxes are taken out of the
lump sum payout. If the winner elects to take an annual installment,
taxes are paid out over the period of the annuity, usually 30 years.
Since the taxes are not taken out in a lump sum, the annuity provides
more money over time.
